00051 /// String describing quantile norm algorithm
00052 #define SKETCHQUANTNORMSTR "quant-norm"
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * SketchQuantNormTran for doing normalization. Can do sketch and full
00056  * quantile (just set sketch to chip size) and supports bioconductor
00057  * compatibility. Unfortunatley this is kind of a bad stream currently as it
00058  * doesn't really flow any data through...
00059  */
00060 class SketchQuantNormTran : public ChipStream {
00061 
00062 public:
00063 
00064   /** 
00065    * Constructor.
00066    *
00067    * @param sketchSize - Number of data points to use for
00068    * approximating full quantile normalization.
00069    * @param biocCompat - Should ties in rank be done in same manner as
00070    * bioconductor affy package?
00071    * @param lowPrecision - Should we truncate values as if we had been written to cel file?
00072    * @param usePmSubset - Should we use just the perfect match probes for normalization?
00073    * @param target - what should we scale the target sketch to
00074    * @param doavg - should we use the mean (rather than median)
00075    */
00076   SketchQuantNormTran(int sketchSize, bool biocCompat, 
00077                       bool lowPrecision, bool usePmSubset,
00078                       float target, bool doavg);
00079 
00080   /**
00081    * Destructor. 
00082    */
00083   ~SketchQuantNormTran();
00084 
00085   /** 
00086    * @brief Only use a subset of all probes for normalization. For
00087    * example RMA only uses PM probes or might want to just use control
00088    * genes.
00089    * @param subsetProbes - bitmask indicating which probes to use for
00090    * normalization.
00091    */
00092   void setSubProbes(const vector<bool> &subsetProbes);
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * @brief Add a stream to the list of those that will receive
00096    * downstream data.
00097    * @param stream - ChipStream that wants to be fed our modified
00098    * data.
00099    */
00100   virtual void registerStream(ChipStream *stream) {
00101     m_Streams.push_back(stream);
00102   }
00103   
00104   /** 
00105    * @brief register our parent stream that will be passing
00106    * data to this object.
00107    * @param stream - who are we getting data from?
00108    */
00109   virtual void registerParent(ChipStream *stream) {
00110     m_ParentStream = stream;
00111   }
00112 
00113   /** 
00114    * @brief Get a reference to our parent stream.
00115    * @return Reference to parent stream.
00116    */
00117   virtual const ChipStream &getParent() {
00118     return *m_ParentStream;
00119   }
00120 
00121   void setProbeCount(int probeCount) { 
00122     if(m_SketchSize == -1) {
00123       m_SketchSize = Max((int)(.01 * probeCount), 50000);
00124       m_SketchSize = Min(50000, probeCount);
00125       Verbose::out(2, "Setting sketch size to: " + ToStr(m_SketchSize));
00126     }
00127     else if(m_SketchSize == 0) {
00128       m_SketchSize = probeCount;
00129       Verbose::out(2, "Setting sketch size to entire chip: " + ToStr(m_SketchSize));
00130     }
00131   }
00132

00141   /** 
00142    * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00143    * @param data - vector of cel file data.
00144    */
00145   void newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart);
00146    
00147   /** 
00148    * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will not be
00149    * called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the sketches and then
00150    * does the normalization when this function is called. This makes it
00151    * difficult to pass through data to downstream. If a precomputed sketch
00152    * is supplied then the data can be passed through chip by chip.
00153    */
00154   void endDataSet();

00160   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();

00166   static void setUpSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);

00189   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);

00191   /** 
00192    * @brief Is the portion of the chip comprising pm probes being used as a subset?
00193    * @return true if pm subset is being used false otherwise.
00194    */
00195   inline bool getUsePmSubset() { return m_UsePmSubset; }
00196 
00197   /** 
00198    * @brief Set a filename to write out the quantile distrubtion to. This
00199    * can then be used to normalize new cel files to an old batch without
00200    * rerunning the entire batch. 
00201    * 
00202    * @param fileName - name of file to write distribution sampled to.
00203    */
00204   void saveTargetSketch(const std::string& fileName) {
00205     m_FileOutName = fileName;
00206   }
00207   void saveTargetSketch_a5(const std::string& fileName) {
00208     m_a5_filename = fileName;
00209   }
00210   void saveTargetSketch_group_a5(affx::File5_Group* group5) {
00211     m_a5_shared_group = group5;
00212   }
00213 
00214   /** 
00215    * @brief Set a target distribution to normalize all the chips to.
00216    * Note that this routine will give slightly different values than the 
00217    * matching routine 
00218    * @param targetSketch 
00219    */
00220   void setTargetSketch(const std::vector<float> &targetSketch) {
00221     if(targetSketch.size() != m_SketchSize) {
00222       Err::errAbort("SketchQuantNormTran::setTargetSketch() - " + 
00223                       ToStr("target sketch (N=") + ToStr(targetSketch.size()) + 
00224                       ") must be same size as sketch (N=" + ToStr(m_SketchSize));
00225     }
00226     m_AverageSketch = targetSketch;
00227     if(!m_BiocCompat) {
00228       m_PartialSums.resize(m_AverageSketch.end() - m_AverageSketch.begin() + 1);
00229       m_PartialSums[0] = 0;
00230       std::transform(m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end(), m_PartialSums.begin() + 1, adder<double>());
00231     }
00232     m_UsePrecompSketch = true;
00233     scaleTargetSketch();
00234   }
00235 
00236   /** 
00237    * How big is the sketch being used? If zero then entire dataset.
00238    * @return - Size of the subset of probes being used for normalization.
00239    */
00240   unsigned int getSketchSize() { return m_SketchSize; }
00241 
00242   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00243 
00244   /**
00245    * Open and read a target distribution from a text file. Must have a column
00246    * called 'intensities' with distribution quantiles sorted from highest to
00247    * lowest.
00248    *
00249    * @param fileName - text file containing column of quantiles.
00250    * @param targetSketch - vector to load up with our intensities
00251    */
00252   static void readTargetSketchFromFile(const std::string& fileName, std::vector<float> &targetSketch);

00254 //protected:
00255   
00256   /** 
00257    * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00258    * probe in a particular microarray.
00259    * 
00260    * @param probeIx - Probe index from the cel file.
00261    * @param chipIx - Set of chips from same sample.
00262    * @param intensity - Original intensities.
00263    * @param return - transformed intensities.
00264    */
00265   // transform a vector of intensities
00266   void transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity);
00267   // transform a single intensity
00268   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity);
00269 
00270   /**
00271    * update the partial sums based on m_AverageSketch
00272    */
00273   void updatePartialSums() {
00274     m_PartialSums.clear();
00275     if(!m_BiocCompat) {
00276         m_PartialSums.resize(m_AverageSketch.end() - m_AverageSketch.begin() + 1);
00277         m_PartialSums[0] = 0;
00278         std::transform(m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end(), m_PartialSums.begin() + 1, adder<double>());
00279     }
00280   }
00281 
00282   /**
00283    * @brief Scale the target sketch
00284    */
00285   void scaleTargetSketch();
00286   
00287   /** 
00288    * Save the current m_AverageSketch to a file.
00289    * @param fileName - where to write the sketch.
00290    */  
00291   void saveTargetSketchToFile(const std::string& fileName);
00292   void saveTargetSketchToFile_a5(const std::string& fileName);
00293   void saveTargetSketchToGroup_a5(affx::File5_Group* group5);
00294 
00295   /** 
00296    * Obtain a sketch for a given vector of data.
00297    * @param data - data to sample sketch from.
00298    */
00299   void extractSketch(std::vector<float> &data);
00300 
00301   /** 
00302    * End reading chips when we have to compute the target
00303    * (m_AverageSketch) ourselves.
00304    */
00305   void computeTargetSketch();
00306 
00307   /** 
00308    * When we have a precomputed distribution to normalize against
00309    * we can handle things differently, like passing data through rather
00310    * than caching it for computing target sketch.
00311    * @param data - vector of vectors of new chip data from same sample.
00312    */
00313   void newChipSuppliedTargetSketch(std::vector<float> &data);
00314   /// Function object for extracting sketches.
00315   ExtractSketch< vector<float>::iterator> *m_ExtractSketch;
00316   /// Vector representing our target (or average) distribution.
00317   std::vector<float> m_AverageSketch;
00318   /// Vector with the partial sums of the average sketch for handling ties correctly
00319   std::vector<double> m_PartialSums;
00320   /// Collection of sub-vectors that are our sketches.
00321   std::vector< std::vector<float>::iterator > m_Sketches;
00322   /// Memory that we have to free when we are done.
00323   std::vector< std::vector<float> * > m_ToFree;
00324   /// Bitmask telling us which probes to use for normalization.
00325   std::vector<bool> m_SubProbes;
00326   /// How big of a sketch are we using?
00327   int m_SketchSize;
00328   /// How many probes are we actually using for normalization.
00329   int m_SubProbeCount;
00330   /// Should we resolve ties same way as bioconductor affy package?
00331   bool m_BiocCompat;
00332   /// Should we mimic the truncation seen in normalized cel files?
00333   bool m_LowPrecision;
00334   /// Should we only use subset of probes?
00335   bool m_UsePmSubset;
00336   /// Should we use a pre supplied sketch?
00337   bool m_UsePrecompSketch;
00338   /// target to scale the sketch to
00339   float m_Target;
00340   /// scale to the average (versus median)
00341   bool m_DoAverage;
00342   /// Where to save precomputed sketch.
00343   std::string m_FileOutName;
00344   ///
00345   std::string m_a5_filename;
00346   ///
00347   affx::File5_Group* m_a5_shared_group;
00348 
00349   /// Md5sum of probe ids used.
00350   std::string m_ProbeMd5sum;
00351 };
